name: Example Protocol
description: Example Protocol is a DeFi protocol deployed on multi-chain. Security researchers can submit vulnerability reports through the WhiteClaws platform.

critical.description: Direct theft of any user funds, draining liquidity pools, contract destruction

high.description: Code significant impact affecting protocol availability or user funds

medium.description: Localized impact, single user or temporary denial of service

low.description: Low impact, non-exploitable issues, information disclosure

out_of_scope: Issues from outdated compiler versions already documented

report_format: Detailed vulnerability description including affected functions
Proof of Concept (code or transaction simulation)
Impact analysis with realistic attack scenario

severity_criteria.critical: Direct loss of funds, protocol insolvency, or permanent freezing of funds exceeding $1M
severity_criteria.high: Temporary freezing of funds, manipulation of protocol parameters, or theft below critical threshold
severity_criteria.medium: Griefing attacks, gas optimization issues with material impact, or accounting discrepancies
severity_criteria.low: Informational findings, best practice violations, or low-impact edge cases

eligibility: Submissions from current or former employees/contractors of the protocol team are not eligible
Findings must be original work — no re-submission of known issues
